info.description: API retrieves the transaction code details defined in the system
info.title: Transaction Codes

get.description: API to retrieve information on transaction code such as transaction narrative, type,  initiation type and charges associated with code.

parameters.name: transactionCode
parameters.description: Identifies the system internal transaction code applicable to the transaction

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: The identifier of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

post.description: API to create information on transaction code such as transaction narrative, type,  initiation type and charges associated with code.

parameters.name: transactionCode
parameters.description: Identifies the system internal transaction code applicable to the transaction

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: body Payload

parameters.name: validate_only
parameters.description: The identifier to indicate if it is set to only validate or not.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: The identifier of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

put.description: API to update information on transaction code such as transaction narrative, type,  initiation type and charges associated with code.

parameters.name: transactionCode
parameters.description: Identifies the system internal transaction code applicable to the transaction

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: body Payload

parameters.name: validate_only
parameters.description: The identifier to indicate if it is set to only validate or not.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: The identifier of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

get.description: Retrieves all transaction codes defined in the system with details such as transaction narrative, type,  initiation type and charges associated with code.

parameters.name: transactionCode
parameters.description: Identifies the system internal transaction code applicable to the transaction

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The total number of records per page

parameters.name: page_start
parameters.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from t24 on every enquiry request.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: The identifier of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

parameters.name: disablePagination
parameters.description: Indicates the pagination header attributes availability. If set to 'true', it fetches all the data

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

uniqueIdentifier.description: The unique identifier/Message Reference of the record created.

T24_time.description: Time taken to response by T24

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

chargeIds.description: This indicates the charge code which will be triggered for payment stop instruction. Applicable when financial institutions would like to charge for stop payment of cheque etc.

chargeId.description: This indicates the charge code which will be triggered for payment stop instruction. Applicable when financial institutions would like to charge for stop payment of cheque etc.

categoryId.description: Unique identifier associated with the product name of the account or contract. For example: For customer/counterparty accounts, the identifier would be in the range 1000 to 9999. For ledger accounts, in the range 10000 to 19999.

productId.description: Contains the unique identifier of the product, e.g. the product id of the arrangement account.

transactionId.description: Unique transaction identifier for retrieving the details of the transaction. For example: FT0102030333 etc.

chequeTransaction.description: Indicates whether the transactions using this code requires mandatory cheque number

chequeTypeId.description: Indicates the type of Cheques for which payment stop instruction is effective

chequeIdRequired.description: Indicates whether the transactions using this code requires mandatory reference number

debitCreditIndicator.description: Indicator flag which is set whenever a debit or a credit transaction happens in the account

includeInTurnoverCharge.description: Indicates whether the transaction using this code are to be included in the calculation of Debit/Credit turnover charges

swiftNarrative.description: Indicates the SWIFT narrative corresponding to the transaction code as per the rules specified in the SWIFT user handbook

transactionInitiationType.description: Defines the initiator type of transaction. Example - bank or customer

statementReferenceField.description: Defines if reference has to appear as part statement narrative.

statementNarrativeFormatId.description: Identifier of the statement narration format record.

exemptDispoProcessing.description: Indicates if the transaction is to excluded from dispo processing

exposureDateConditionId.description: Identifier of the Exposure condition record

transactionType.description: Identifies the transaction type applicable to the transaction being processed, i.e. outward or inward payment. For example: ACPX, OTPX etc.

narrative.description: The additional text printed on descriptive statements in addition to the standard narrative and/or reference

description.description: Contains the description of purpose of the payment.

immediateCharge.description: Boolean field to indicate if the charge is to be colelcted from the Account immediately.  Possible values: Y = Charge must be levied immediately, i.e. when the transaction is booked.  NO=  Charge must not be levied when the transaction is booked and Blank- Default value that implies that the charge is not levied immediately.

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

uniqueIdentifier.description: The unique identifier/Message Reference of the record created.

T24_time.description: Time taken to response by T24

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

code.description: The code related to override message.

options.description: The usable options for the override.

code.description: The identifier of the error message
The identifier of the error message

message.description: The actual t24 error message for bad requests

type.description: The identifier of error type: Business

code.description: The identifier of the error message

message.description: The actual t24 error message caused by server

type.description: The identifier of error type: System

page_start.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

total_size.description: The total number of records present

page_token.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from t24 on every enquiry request

transactionInitiationType.description: Defines the initiator type of transaction. Example - bank or customer

responseCode.description: The user input to accept/reject the override.
